platformer

Class QBackground

  • java.lang.Object
    • platformer.QBackground

  • public class QBackground
extends java.lang.Object
    Background class that will hopefully be useful, I spent too much brainpower on it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QBackground(int x, int y, int worldWidth, int worldHeight, int screenWidth, int screenHeight)
      Background class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QBackground

        public QBackground(int x,
           int y,
           int worldWidth,
           int worldHeight,
           int screenWidth,
           int screenHeight)
        Background class. It is probably riddled with bunch of bugs, so please be careful.
        Parameters:
        x - The lowest x coordinate possible as stated by map.
        y - The lowest y coordinate possible as stated by map.
        worldWidth - The Width of the whole world as stated by map.
        worldHeight - The Height of the whole world as stated by map.
        screenWidth - The screen width in the game.
        screenHeight - The screen height in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • setBackground

        public void setBackground(java.awt.image.BufferedImage background)
        Set the background image for this world. The background will be changed in size in accordance with the parameters passed previously.
        Parameters:
        background - The image that will be our background.

      • setMidGround

        public void setMidGround(java.awt.image.BufferedImage midGround)
        Sets the midground image for this world. It will be duplicated and tiled horizontally in accordance with the width of the world.
        Parameters:
        midGround - The image that will be ou midground.

      • addForegroundObject

        public void addForegroundObject(java.awt.image.BufferedImage object)
        Adds an image to the list of the images that can be in the foreground.
        Parameters:
        object - an object that can be a foreground image.

      • setBackgroundShift

        public void setBackgroundShift(int backgroundShift)
        Sets how slowly the background will move in respect to the camera. The higher the number the slower the movement.
        Parameters:
        backgroundShift - The shift for the background.

      • setMidgroundShift

        public void setMidgroundShift(int midgroundShift)
        Sets how slowly the midground will move in respect to the camera. The higher the number the slower the movement. Please use common sense and ensure this number is smaller than background shift.
        Parameters:
        midgroundShift - The shift for the midground.

      • generateBackground

        public void generateBackground(int density)
        Generates the background. Call this method otherwise you will not have a background. This method stretches image for the background, horizontally duplicates images for the midground, and randomly generates foreground based on the items that you passed.
        Parameters:
        density - The density of the items for the foreground.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
        QCamera camera)
        Draws the background, followed by midground and followed by foreground. This method will just call the other draw method, so please call other draw method using draw(g, camera.getX(), camera.getY());
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics onto which to draw.
        camera - The camera whose coordinates we want for drawing images accordingly

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
        int x,
        int y)
        Draws the background, followed by midground and followed by foreground.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics onto which we will draw images.
        x - The x coordinate of the camera.
        y - The y coordinate of the camera.
